thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Thursday, 18 Jan 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: Turkey's parliament votes to extend emergency rule for three more months: media

author: Reuters Editorial
title: Turkey's parliament votes to extend emergency rule for three more months: media
text:
ANKARA (Reuters) - The Turkish parliament on Thursday voted in favor of extending a state of emergency imposed shortly after the 2016 coup attempt for a sixth time by another three months, broadcaster CNN Turk said.
The latest extension of the state of emergency means Turkey will have spent a year and a half under emergency rule, under which the president and government are allowed to bypass parliament in passing new laws and suspend rights and freedoms.
Reporting by Tuvan Gumrukcu; Editing by Ece Toksabay
